page.title: 07HISTORICAL PLACES TO VISIT
page.content: The historical places to visit in St.Margarets and Turnastone are very few because the area is very rural.One of the biggest places to visit is a camp at grid reference 339364.There is a famous church at St.Margarets.In the church is a plaque which has different figures carved into it which make it look like lace embeded into it. There is a castle over-looking the area which is built up on a hill.Another tump is located in the area which is a very beautiful place to visit. When Queen Elizabeth 1 was on the throne a man called Roland Vaughan who was her architect designed mills and weirs around the Golden Valley to improve the farming in the area.Some of the building foundations are still to be found today.
